title: Journal of Manufacturing Science and Engineering Open Issues

items.title: Inline Monitoring of Balling in DE Deposition
items.summary:
- *Inline monitoring* of the *balling phenomenon* during *Directed Energy Deposition* to enable real-time assessment.
- Balling impacts bead quality and process stability, highlighting its causes and potential mitigation strategies.
- The work supports *in-situ process control* for improved accuracy in additive manufacturing.

items.title: A Meta-Learning Based Surface Roughness Prediction During SiCp/Al Composites Machining
In Situ Investigation of the Tool–Particle Interaction During Orthogonal Cutting of SiCp/Al Composite
Modeling of a Roll-to-Roll Packaging Process Using System Identification and Deep Learning
Adversarial Domain Adaptation for Improved Part-to-Part Generalization of Deep Learning Segmentation Models in Aerosol Jet Printing
PEEK Curved Lap Joints for On-Orbit Welding
items.author: Tian, S.; Li, P.; Bei, Z.; Yan, J.; Zhang, L.; Qiu, G.; You, L.
items.summary: - This study investigates *PEEK*-based curved lap joints designed for **ultrasonic welding** to enable rapid *on-orbit* construction of truss structures.\n- The design and validation assess geometry, materials, and weld quality to ensure structural reliability in space environments.\n- The work highlights potential benefits for on-orbit assembly, including reduced assembly time and enhanced durability of space-frame systems.

items.title: Effect of Feeding Strategy on the Microstructure and Microhardness in Friction Stir-Based Additive Manufacturing of Aluminum Alloy Powder
Strategies for Controlling Metallurgical Transformations and Mechanical Properties in Al/Steel Friction Welding: A Review
Deep Learning-Based Anomaly Detection for Laser-Fused Metal Components Using Pyrometric Data
Hydraulically Supported Robot-Assisted ISF for Al6061
items.author: Singh, R. P., Kumar, S., Brambley, E., Singh, P. K., Gangaraju, K.
items.summary:
- *Hydraulically supported robot-assisted incremental sheet forming* enables improved formability of *Al6061* sheets under controlled conditions.
- The study provides extensive experimental data on process parameters, tool paths, and forming forces, enabling optimization of *ISF* for aluminum alloys.
- Findings include effects on surface quality, accuracy, and process stability, with potential implications for lightweight automotive and aerospace manufacturing.

items.title: Fast Tool Breakage Monitoring: A Decision Level Fusion-Based Approach Using Vibration and Sound Signal
Fast Tool Breakage Monitoring: Fusion of Vibration and Sound
items.author: Bai, L., Yan, J., López de Lacalle, L. N., Urbikain, G., González, H., Zhang, J.
items.summary:
- This study proposes a *decision-level fusion* framework that combines vibration and sound signals for fast tool breakage monitoring in machining operations.
- It aims to improve detection *accuracy* and *robustness* and supports real-time decision making through fusion strategies.
- Experimental results on real machining data show improved performance over single-sensor baselines and discuss practical deployment and *economic* benefits.

items.title: Dressing Spindle Thermal Error in Gear Grinding: Mechanism
items.summary:
- This article investigates how *dressing spindle thermal error* impacts gear surface accuracy during discontinuous profile grinding.
- It analyzes the *mechanism* of thermal drift and proposes **compensation strategies** to improve surface quality.
- The work provides a practical framework for validation and guidance in *precision gear manufacturing*.

items.title: A Review of Through-Silicon Via Inspection and Metrology Technology for Advanced Semiconductor Packaging
Spatially-Informed Online Prediction of Milling Surface Deformation Using Multiphysics-Infused Graph Neural Network for Digital Twinning  1
Spatially-Informed Milling Surface Deformation
items.author: Zhou Q., Zhang Y., Kim J., Imani F., Tang J.
items.summary:
- *Spatially-Informed Online Prediction* of milling surface deformation via a *Multiphysics-infused Graph Neural Network* for *digital twinning*.
- The approach enables real-time predictions to support *digital twin*-driven milling operations and predictive maintenance.
- The work demonstrates integrating multiphysics data with graph learning to capture deformation patterns.

items.title: Integrating Lean Six Sigma with Sustainable Manufacturing: A Framework for Optimized Efficiency and Environmental Performance
Robotic Grinding Surface Topography Modeling Considering Motion Trajectories and Accurate Shapes of Abrasive Grains
Process Parameters in Micro-SPIF: Forces & Surface Quality
items.author: Mohamed Ismail, M. N. B., Wen, D. L. W., Meenashisundaram, G. K., Fong, K. S., Kumar, A. S.
items.summary:
- The paper examines how *process parameters* (step depth, feed rate, tool diameter, toolpath) influence *forming forces* in micro-single-point incremental forming (micro-SPIF).  
- It correlates forming-force behavior with *surface quality* metrics (roughness, waviness, dimensional accuracy), revealing trade-offs and parameter windows that reduce defects.  
- The findings offer practical guidelines to optimize micro-SPIF for improved *surface finish* and dimensional control in micro-manufacturing.

items.title: Impact of Defects on Interfacial Bonding in Multilayer Friction Surfacing Deposited Metal Additive Structure
Enhanced Counterfactual Explanations for Optimizing Three-Dimensional Printing Parameters Using SHAP and Nearest-Neighbor Constraints With Physics-Based Validation
Nanoparticle Reduction of Residual Stress in Aluminum Welding
items.author: Narayanan Murali, Guan-Cheng Chen, Alexander Killips, Xiaochun Li
items.summary:
- *Nanoparticles* added to filler wire significantly reduce welding distortion and *residual stress* in AA2024, AA6061, and AA7075, cutting macroscopic angular distortion by up to **50%**.
- Nano-treated welds show slower heat release during solidification (reduced thermal flux), lower axial strain along the weld, and a ~1–2 mm shortened stressed zone.
- A proposed mechanism: dispersed particles *relax constraints on solidification-induced shrinkage*, enabling nanoparticle-enabled control of residual stress.

items.title: Laser–Material Interaction in L-DED Process
items.author: Arkajyoti Jha, Ramji M, Gopinath Muvvala
items.summary:
- The paper quantifies *energy partitioning* in Laser-Directed Energy Deposition (L-DED) and introduces a novel laser-power-meter method to measure how powder and substrate share incident laser energy.
- Varying *carrier gas flowrate* (10→40 L/min), powder mass flowrate (25–45 g/min), and stand-off distance alters powder cloud density and delivered energy, shifting bead morphology between **high dilution** and **balling**.
- Imaging and thermal measurements of in-flight particles identify an optimized process window and enable practical *in-process waviness control* to improve bead quality.

items.title: Metal Transfer Characteristics of Aluminum Alloy Variable Polarity High-Frequency Pulsed Gas Metal Arc Welding
Machining of Thin-Walled Structures From Stiffness-Driven Additive Manufacturing
items.summary: *The article introduces a computational method to determine the preform geometry for *additively manufactured* thin-walled structures.* This method ensures the preform maintains near-constant *static stiffness* across its width, allowing reliable machining.* An application example on a straight single boundary structure illustrates the approach's effectiveness.*

items.title: Deposition Volume Compensation for Enhanced Shape Fidelity in Nested Printing
items.summary:
- The study proposes a *deposition volume compensation* method to improve *shape fidelity* in *nested 3D printing* processes.
- It addresses issues of dimensional accuracy and surface quality by adjusting material deposition based on *predictive modeling*.
- This approach enhances the *precision and reliability* of complex printed structures, relevant for advanced manufacturing applications.

items.title: A Crystal Plasticity Model for Machining Single Crystals
items.summary:
*A phenomenological crystal plasticity model predicts *cutting forces* in orthogonal machining of *single-crystal materials*.
- It accounts for *temperature*, *strain rate*, and *strain hardening* effects, integrating modified Johnson–Cook laws.
- The model successfully matches *experimental results* on copper and aluminum, helping understand *anisotropic deformation* in machining.*

items.title: Weld Zones in Friction Stir Welding: Material Flow and Defects
items.author: Agiwal, H.; Franke, D.; Zinn, M.; Rudraraju, S.; Pfefferkorn, F. E.
items.summary:
- The paper conducts *empirical analyses* of *weld zones* to examine how *material flow* occurs during *friction stir welding*.
- It links *process parameters* and weld-zone features to *defect formation* and its distribution in FSW.
- Published in the ASME Journal of Manufacturing Science and Engineering, the work advances *manufacturing science* by connecting observations to welding performance.

items.title: A Ceramic Additive Manufacturing Process via Pulsed-Continuous Dual-Beam Laser Powder Bed Fusion
Effect of LPBF Process Parameters on Thermomechanical Properties of a Copper-Based Metal Matrix Composite
items.summary:
- *Laser Powder Bed Fusion (LPBF)* process parameters significantly influence the *thermomechanical properties* of *copper-based metal matrix composites*.
- The study assesses how variations in process settings affect *material performance* and *microstructure*.
- Understanding these relationships enables optimization for *better mechanical strength* and *thermal stability* of 3D-printed copper composites.

items.title: Optical Monitoring in Powder Deposition
items.summary:
*The study develops a *non-invasive optical system* to monitor powder flow characteristics such as *mass flowrate*, *particle size*, and *velocity* in laser-directed energy deposition.*
- The system uses a *high-speed camera* and *backlighting* to capture real-time data, validated against machine parameters and baseline measurements.*
- This method enhances *accuracy* and *insight* into powder flow variations, which are critical for ensuring *geometrical* and *metallurgical quality* in additive manufacturing processes.

items.title: Effects of Electrostatic Force on Conducting Polymer Jets in Electric Field-Assisted Direct Ink Writing
items.summary:
- *Electrostatic forces* significantly influence the behavior of *conducting polymer jets* in *electric field-assisted direct ink writing*. 
- Understanding these forces can improve *precision* and *control* in *additive manufacturing processes*. 
- The study highlights the importance of *electrostatic interactions* for optimizing *printing techniques* for *conducting materials*.

items.title: Fatigue Modeling for Laser-Fused Metal Components With Small Data
items.summary:
*This research addresses *fatigue modeling* for *laser-fused metal components* using *small data sets*.
- It discusses how to manage *scattering* in data to improve *reliability*.
- The study highlights *innovative approaches* to enhance *predictive accuracy* in *metal additive manufacturing*.

*Keywords:* fatigue, laser fusion, metal components, small data, reliability, scattering, modeling

items.title: Time-Series Data-Driven Machine Learning of Milling Chattering
Detection of Part Porosity in Additive Manufacturing Using Machining
items.summary: *The study explores how *machining processes* can be used to detect *porosity* in additive manufactured parts.*  *Porosity impacts the mechanical properties and integrity of 3D-printed components.*  *This research advances *non-destructive testing* techniques for ensuring *quality control* in additive manufacturing.*

items.title: Rapid Commissioning of Large Machine Tools Using Finite Element-Based Correction of Geometric Errors
items.summary:
*The paper introduces a method for *rapidly* commissioning large machine tools.*
- It employs *finite element-based correction* to address *geometric errors.*
- This approach aims to improve *accuracy* and *efficiency* in machine tool setup, impacting manufacturing productivity.*

items.title: Single-Layer Photopolymerization Process for the Rapid Fabrication of Nature-Inspired Multifunctional Films
items.author: Ketki M. Lichade, Sai Hamsitha Reddy Guvvala, Mohammed Gayasuddin Shaik
items.summary:
- The *Single-Layer Photopolymerization (SLP)* method enables rapid creation of nature-inspired microstructured films for versatile applications.
- SLP utilizes a single digital mask for efficient patterning without pre- or postprocessing, creating structures quickly and sustainably.
- Demonstrated applications include surfaces inspired by *moth eyes*, *mosquitoes*, and *shark skin*, enhancing properties like adhesion and flexibility.

items.title: Material Behavior of Magnetoresponsive Polymer Composites in Extrusion-Based Direct Writing
items.author: Anasheh Khecho, Erina Baynojir Joyee
items.summary:
- This paper discusses *Direct Writing (DW)*, a significant technique in *additive manufacturing* for polymer-particle composites used across various fields. 
 - The study highlights how integrating *external forces*, especially magnetic fields, can enhance printing accuracy by improving ink rheology and *interlayer adhesion*. 
 - Findings indicate that *Fe₃O₄* particles increase elasticity of inks, while non-magnetic particles like *SiC* can disrupt the printing process, emphasizing the need for precise control in DW applications.

items.title: Data-Driven Optimization of Bioink Formulations
items.author: Sarah R., Rohauer R., Schimmelpfennig K., Limon S. M., Lewis C. L., Habib A.
items.summary:
- This research focuses on using *data-driven approaches* to enhance *bioink formulations* for bioprinting.
- A predictive modeling approach aims to improve the *efficiency and effectiveness* of extrusion-based bioprinting.
- The findings contribute to the *advancement of additive manufacturing* technologies in the biomedicine field.

items.title: Process Control for Direct Ink Writing of Composite Materials Via Reinforcement Learning
items.author: Li, Z., Chen, W., Guo, Z., Zhou, C., Sun, H.
items.summary:
- The paper explores *process control* techniques for *direct ink writing* (DIW) of composite materials using *reinforcement learning*. 
- It emphasizes the effectiveness of machine learning in optimizing material deposition and control mechanisms. 
- This study contributes to advancements in additive manufacturing and material science, specifically for *composite materials*.

items.title: Tool Path Planning Method for Parametric Surfaces
items.author: Li, Y., Li, C., Huang, J., Yan, G., Xu, J., Liu, K.
items.summary:
- This research presents a *novel method* for *tool path planning* using a Piecewise Coons Stream Function on Hierarchical T-Meshes. 
- The approach aims to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of planning for *parametric surfaces*. 
- Findings and methodologies are aimed at advancing *manufacturing technologies*.

items.title: Hybrid High-Power Laser and Mechanical Drilling
items.author: Ren, J., Cheng, D., Sun, X., Yu, S., Li, L., Wei, C.
items.summary:
- The study explores *hybrid laser and mechanical drilling* techniques for thick CFRP laminates.
- It presents findings on the efficiency and effectiveness of using such hybrid methods.
- This research contributes to advancements in *manufacturing technology* and composite materials processing.

items.title: In-Process Characterizations of Nanoscale Machining
items.author: Xinchen Wang, Mohammad Alshoul, Jia Deng, Zimo Wang
items.summary:
- The study focuses on *real-time monitoring* of nanoscale morphology during machining using *Acoustic Emission (AE) sensors*.
- It establishes a predictive model that connects AE spectral responses to surface characteristics, achieving an accuracy of **82%**.
- The research highlights the significant potential of AE sensors in enhancing *quality inspection* processes in nanofabrication.

items.title: Cognitive Digital Twin for Multiobjective Production Scheduling
items.author: Hankang Lee, Hui Yang
items.summary:
- The paper introduces a **Cognitive Digital Twin (CDT)** approach for optimizing multiobjective production scheduling.
- CDT enhances **decentralized decision-making** through collaborative multiagent learning, focusing on various objectives such as throughput and workload balance.
- Experimental results validate that CDT significantly improves operational performance compared to traditional methods, emphasizing the potential for **next-generation smart manufacturing**.

items.title: Self-Supported Printing of Gelatin Composite-Based Engineered Living Materials
items.author: Alghamdi, A., Zhou, C., Shams, A. T., Robinson, J. T., Wang, R., Rawlinson, T., Yamaguchi, H., Huang, Y.
items.summary:
- This research paper discusses the innovative *self-supported printing* technique for creating **engineered living materials** using gelatin composites.
- It highlights the integration of advanced manufacturing processes to achieve high precision in bioprinting.
- The findings contribute significantly to the field of *biofabrication*, offering potential applications in various biomedical fields.

items.title: Layer-Wise Emission Prediction for Laser Powder Bed Fusion With an Attribution-Based Explainable Deep Learning Model
Rib Folding Defect Prediction in Spin-Extrusion
items.author: Zhengwu Zhu, Yixi Zhao, Zhongqi Yu, Yawen Ouyang
items.summary:
- This study focuses on predicting *rib folding defects* in the *spin-extrusion forming* (SEF) of thin-walled cylindrical rings with external cross ribs. 
- Two indices are proposed: the *rib aspect ratio* and the *relative error* regarding the feeding roll profile versus the component profile. 
- The *mechanism* behind rib folding is extensively analyzed using finite element simulations, highlighting the impact of squeezing forces and motion interference.
